intro: Linaria saphiria, commonly known as the Sapphire Toadflax, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and features slender, branched stems. Its leaves are linear and slightly hairy, while the flowers are tubular with two prominent lips. Linaria saphiria is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
